sentences.english: She had sex with 919 guys in a single day, setting a world record.
sentences.chinese: 她在一天和919個男人完成性愛，創造了世界紀錄。

sentences.english: Phelps' eight gold medals and seven world records left you in awe.
sentences.chinese: 菲爾普斯的八塊金牌和七項世界紀錄讓人肅然起敬。

sentences.english: The pole vaulter bettered the world's record by five inches.
sentences.chinese: 這名撐杆跳高運動員以5英寸之多超過了世界紀錄。

sentences.english: May soon be "a" world record walleye " was " caught Columbia "River.
sentences.chinese: 世界紀錄沃萊可能很快就被抓住了哥倫比亞河。

sentences.english: The barbeque was meant to shatter the world record for the globe's largest grill-off.
sentences.chinese: 這次烤肉野餐意圖打破最大型燒烤盛會的世界紀錄。

sentences.english: Marie Michel's fifth child was one for the record books.
sentences.chinese: 瑪利亞米歇爾的第五個孩子可以載入世界紀錄大全了。

sentences.english: He is the world record holder in the marathon.
sentences.chinese: 他是馬拉松世界紀錄保持者。

sentences.english: The achievement he made heads the world record.
sentences.chinese: 他創造的成績打破了世界紀錄。

sentences.english: Michael, the broadcast just announced that Johnson has broken the world men's 100-meter record.
sentences.chinese: 廣播剛剛宣佈約翰遜打破了男子100米世界紀錄。

sentences.english: He wants the record to be broken.
sentences.chinese: 他希望這一世界紀錄作古。

sentences.english: President Bush saw him set one of his world records.
sentences.chinese: 總統布什目睹他刷新了自己的世界紀錄。

sentences.english: French yachtsman has broken the record for sailing round the world single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 一名法國航海家打破了環遊世界的世界紀錄。

sentences.english: Mass wiggle earns German city a new hula hoop record.
sentences.chinese: 德國城市創下集體轉呼拉圈世界紀錄。

sentences.english: Several world records for speed and range of a flight was established by the IL-62.
sentences.chinese: 它創造數項速度和航程的世界紀錄。

sentences.english: Yeah, he broke the weightlifting world record in the clean-and-jerk in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，他零三年的時候還打破了挺舉的世界紀錄呢。

sentences.english: Write down the world record for the 110-meter-hurdle race for males.
sentences.chinese: 寫下世界紀錄爲110米跨欄跑，爲男性。

definition: special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
Asian area/the Far East/Asia Pacific region
